data.enText: a feeling of anger or dislike towards sb because of sth bad they have done to you in the past
He has a grudge against the world.
I don't hold any grudges now.

data.chText: 他是一个心怀怨恨的人。
data.enText: He's a man with a grudge.

data.chText: 英格兰队在一场势不两立的比赛中打败了新西兰队。
data.enText: England beat New Zealand in a grudge match (= a match where there is strong dislike between the teams) .

data.chText: 勉强做；不情愿地给；吝惜
data.enText: to do or give sth unwillingly

data.chText: 得付这么多的税我很不情愿。
data.enText: I grudge having to pay so much tax.

data.chText: 他不情愿上班花这么多时间在路上。
data.enText: He grudges the time he spends travelling to work.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: to think that sb does not deserve to have sth

data.chText: 她获得成功，你没有不以为然吧？
data.enText: You surely don't grudge her her success?

tr: a resentment strong enough to justify retaliation

value.def: If you have or bear a grudge against someone, you have unfriendly feelings towards them because of something they did in the past.

example.ex: He appears to have a grudge against certain players...
example.tran: 他看来对某些选手怀恨在心。

example.ex: There is no doubt it was an accident and I bear no grudges.
example.tran: 这无疑是个意外，我没有怨言。
